title: Tesco's new Clubcard Plus promises £400 a year savings
text:

It's free to get a Tesco Clubcard - which lets you collect points in store and swap them for money-off vouchers on future purchases - but a new version is launching offering far bigger rewards.

The soon-to-launch Tesco Clubcard Plus scheme lets people knock 10% off the price of two "big shops" a month, up to a value of £40.

That could save you as much as £480 on essentials over the course of the year - but it's not free to join.

Signing up costs you £7.99 a month - although it comes with other benefits too, including 10% off selected Tesco brands in-store, double data from Tesco Mobile - while Tesco Bank credit card users will benefit from no foreign exchange fees abroad.

(Image: Getty Images)

But the key question is when do the savings become worth the price of subscription?

The biggest savings are for people who spend the most - with people spending £400 a month or more in store able to make a profit of £384.12 over the year once the cost of subscription is deducted.

In order to break even, you'll need to spend at least £79.90 a month over two shops - or £40 twice a month, every month - to cover the cost of subscription.

Anything more than that and you should be quids in.

The good news is that, if you remember in time, you can sign up and cancel the deal by the month.

That means if you have a big shop planned ahead of - say - Christmas, you can make sure you bag that little bit extra off, then shut down until you need it again.

(Image: TESCO)

However, people planning to pop in and grab some gin and lottery tickets to take them over the spend needed to save money could be in for a surprise.

Tesco said certain products will be excluded from the 10% off deal - but has not revealed exactly what yet.

Looking at the regular fuel offer - which gives you 10p a litre off when you spend £60 in store - we can make some educated guesses.

For its fuel deal, Tesco excluded anything bought at its café, tobacco kiosks, opticians, phone store, concessions, travel money and Tesco Bank.

It also doesn’t apply to fuel, lottery products, gift cards, e-top ups, savings stamps, postage stamps, 10p carrier bags, prescription medicines or infant milk formulae you buy.

Alessandra Bellini, at Tesco, said: "New Clubcard Plus is a breakthrough innovation giving customers even more ways to get the best value while shopping at Tesco, for their everyday essentials, weekly shops, Mobile and Banking."
description: You can save £40 a month - or £480 a year - using the new Tesco Clubcard Plus scheme. But it comes with a fee. This is how much you need to spend in store to make it worthwhile
